bibl.title: The Status of Peregrine Law in Egypt: 'Customary Law' and Legal Pluralism in the Roman Empire.
bibl.note: 1. Peregrine law in Roman Egypt. - 2. Legal vacuum. - 3. Mos regionis. - 4. Custom and customary law in the late republican sources. - 5. The omission of custom in the jurisprudential source catalogues. - 6. Iul. D. 1.3.32 and the Roman doctrine of custom. - 7. The Roman doctrine of custom and the legal pluralism in the provinces. - 8. The modern doctrine of customary law and the survival of the peregrine law in Egypt. - 9. Roman conceptions of jurisdiction and the law. - 10. Jurisdictional discretion, auctoritas, and the status of peregrine law in Egypt. - Avec résumé en anglais.

bibl.title: Proceedings of the 27th International Congress of Papyrology Warsaw, 29 July - 3 August 2013.

bibl.seg: José Luis Alonso, The Status of Peregrine Law in Egypt: 'Customary Law' and Legal Pluralism in the Roman Empire.
